body_html:
I think there are a couple of issues with this:

  1. Naming: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.expand_dims.html already exists and does unsqueeze, basically. Users aren't going to expect expand_dim to do what you are proposing here.
  2. I don't really the see the use case; most of the time the expands happen implicitly, you rarely want to expand a single dimension explicitly.
body_text:
I think there are a couple of issues with this:

Naming: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.expand_dims.html already exists and does unsqueeze, basically.  Users aren't going to expect expand_dim to do what you are proposing here.
I don't really the see the use case; most of the time the expands happen implicitly, you rarely want to expand a single dimension explicitly.
body:
I think there are a couple of issues with this:
1) Naming: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.expand_dims.html already exists and does unsqueeze, basically.  Users aren't going to expect expand_dim to do what you are proposing here.
2) I don't really the see the use case; most of the time the expands happen implicitly, you rarely want to expand a single dimension explicitly.
